result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gustavo Valdez Jr

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 11/2/2022 received and filed.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:40 AM Defendant Gustavo Valdez Jr in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Gustavo Valdez Jr.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Molly Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

3:15 PM Defendant Gustavo Valdez Jr in court.  Attorney Luis Gutierrez for attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Gustavo Valdez Jr. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gustavo Valdez Jr
Current: 226 E Park Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186   (Effective: 09-13-2022)
Prior: 226 E Park Ave,#Com, Waukesha, WI 53186

10:26 AM Defendant Gustavo Valdez Jr in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defendant states he needs to provide proof to the Public Defenders Office that he does not currently have employment.  The Court provides the defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel and if he does not hear back from the PD's office or qualify, he is to fill out the Petition and bring it back to Court.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:42 PM Defendant Gustavo Valdez Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant states he has since lost his job. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel to allow for the defendant to be re-evaluated by the Public Defender's Office. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. The Defendant to report to WCS within two (2) business day of being released. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

2:11 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Gustavo Valdez Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Gustavo Valdez Jr.  Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
